page.title: 03Pakenham Life(cont.from p2)
page.content: A.Yes it was opposite where the Mace shop is now,and nearby was a petrol pump. Q.Have Pakenham jobs changed? A.Yes lots of men worked on the farms and now most people have to work in Bury. Q.How many pubs were there in Pakenham? A.There were 4 - The Bell,The Fox,The Telegraph and the Royal Oak. Q.Was there electricity? A.Yes,but people got water from wells, pumps and pools because there wasn't piped water. Q.What other changes do you remember? A.Several cottages were knocked down in the street because they were il- legal-they only had one door.The Owell entrance and the village hall stand where the cottages stood.
